intro: Geissorhiza ornithogaloides subsp. flava, commonly known as the yellow geissorhiza, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is a bulbous perennial plant native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped, yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens, though it requires specific conditions to flourish.
